text:
Ha, Guodong and Tian, Zilei and Chen, Jiyao and Wang, Shuo and Luo, Aga and Liu, Yunyu and Tang, Juan and Lai, Ningyuan and Zeng, Fang and Lan, Lei
Front Neurosci, 2022

# Title

Coordinate-based (ALE) meta-analysis of acupuncture for musculoskeletal pain.

# Keywords

activation likelihood estimation
acupuncture
functional magnetic resonance imaging
meta-analysis
musculoskeletal pain

# Abstract
Neuroimaging studies have been widely used to investigate brain regions' alterations in musculoskeletal pain patients. However, inconsistent results have hindered our understanding of the central modulatory effects of acupuncture for musculoskeletal pain. The main objective of our investigation has been to obtain comprehensive evidence of acupuncture for musculoskeletal pain diseases. The PubMed, Web of Science, Google Scholar, Embase, China National Knowledge Infrastructure (CNKI), VIP Database, China Biology Medicine disc Database, Clinical Trial Registration Platform, and Wanfang Database were searched for neuroimaging studies on musculoskeletal pain diseases published from inception up to November 2021. Then, the relevant literature was screened to extract the coordinates that meet the criteria. Finally, the coordinate-based meta-analysis was performed using the activation likelihood estimation algorithm. A total of 15 neuroimaging studies with 183 foci of activation were included in this study. The ALE meta-analysis revealed activated clusters in multiple cortical and sub-cortical brain structures in response to acupuncture across studies, including the thalamus, insula, caudate, claustrum, and lentiform nucleus. The studies showed that acupuncture could modulate different brain regions, including the thalamus, insula, caudate, claustrum, and lentiform nucleus. The findings offer several insights into the potential mechanisms of acupuncture for musculoskeletal pain and provide a possible explanation for the observed clinical benefit of this therapy. https://www.crd.york.ac.uk/prospero/display_record.php?RecordID=227850, identifier: CRD42021227850.
list_title: PMID35937886  Coordinate-based (ALE) meta-analysis of acupuncture for musculoskeletal pain.
